Description: The Jackson Pro Dinky DK8M HT was designed with the modern player in mind.Offering an expanded sonic palette, this eight-string beast has a 28” scale length and features an alder body with arched top, bolt-on maple neck with smooth hand-rubbed urethane gel finish, rock-solid graphite reinforcement and ultra-convenient heel-mount truss rod adjustment wheel. Its speedy 12”-16"compound radius maple fingerboard hosts 24 jumbo frets with a black sharkfin inlay at the 12th fret plus stylish fingerboard and headstock binding.The DKA8M HT is powered by volcanic dual direct mount humbucking pickups— Seymour Duncan® Nazgûl (bridge) and Seymour Duncan® Sentient (neck) —and can be tweaked and refined with its single volume and tone speed knob controls, three-way toggle and momentary kill switch (for stutter effects).Other features include a Jackson HT8 string-through-body hardtail bridge, Planet Waves® Auto-Trim locking tuners, Dunlop dual-locking Straplok® strap retainers, black hardware and 4x4 (4 over, 4 under) AT-1 headstock. This is a killer guitar, great quality and the Seymour Duncans sounds stellar. There are a few small dings on the back of the guitar and the top of the headstock. See the photos, I tried to photograph them the best I could. This is a great guitar and just isn't getting played enough here, the 8 strings just aren't for me.
